This page is for documenting any additional resources on geographic profiling. 

# Papers

Below are a collection of open-access papers on geographic profiling. 

In ecology:

  * Faulkner et al. 2016 [Using geographic profiling to compare the value of sightings vs trap data in a biological invasion](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/ddi.12498)
  * Heald et al. 2019 [Understanding the origins of the ring‐necked parakeet in the UK](https://zslpublications.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/jzo.12753)
  
In epidemiology

  * Le comber et al. 2011 [Geographic profiling as a novel spatial tool for targeting infectious disease control](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3123167/)
  * Verity et al. 2014 [Spatial targeting of infectious disease control: identifying multiple, unknown sources](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/epdf/10.1111/2041-210X.12190)
  * Smith et al. 2015 [Spatial Targeting for Bovine Tuberculosis Control: Can the Locations of Infected Cattle Be Used to Find Infected Badgers?](https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article/file?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0142710&type=printable)

In criminology

  * Rossmo et al. 2014 [Geographic profiling in Nazi Berlin: fact and fiction](https://core.ac.uk/download/pdf/30697125.pdf)

Novel applications

  * Stevens et al. 2020 [Investigating Sherlock Holmes: Using Geographic Profiling to Analyze the Novels of Arthur Conan Doyle](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/00330124.2020.1758575)

# Blogs

  * Faulkner 2014 [Geographic Profiling – a novel tool for locating tarsier sleeping sites](https://www.biodiversityscience.com/2014/09/22/geographic-profiling-tarsier-sites/)
  * Faulkner and Stevens 2018 [Geographic Profiling: Murder, maths, malaria and mammals](http://chalkdustmagazine.com/features/geographic-profiling-murder-maths-malaria-mammals/)
  * Romanach, Faulkner and Stevens 2019 [Targeting wildlife crime interventions through geographic profiling](https://www.illegalwildlifetrade.net/2019/10/28/targeting-wildlife-crime-interventions-through-geographic-profiling/)
